edu.rit.swing

Class DisplayableIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.swing.DisplayableIO

  • public class DisplayableIO
extends Object
    Class DisplayableIO provides static methods for writing displayable objects as image files. You can write PNG files and PostScript files.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image.
      static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image with the given scale factor.
      static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale, int xPpi, int yPpi)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image with the given scale factor and physical pixel dimensions.
      static void writeColorPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a 24-bit color image.
      static void writeColorPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a 24-bit color image with the given scale factor.
      static void writeColorPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale, int xPpi, int yPpi)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a 24-bit color image with the given scale factor and physical pixel dimensions.
      static void writeGrayscalePNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a grayscale image.
      static void writeGrayscalePNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a grayscale image with the given scale factor.
      static void writeGrayscalePNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile, double theScale, int xPpi, int yPpi)
      Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a grayscale image with the given scale factor and physical pixel dimensions.
      static void writePostScriptFile(Displayable theDisplayable, File theFile)
      Write the given displayable object to a PostScript file.

    • Method Detail

      • writeBilevelPNGFile

        public static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable,
                       File theFile)
                                throws IOException
        Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image. The default scale factor (one display unit = one pixel) is used. The default physical pixel dimensions (300×300 pixels per inch) are used.
        Parameters:
        theDisplayable - Displayable object to write.
        theFile - Image file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • writeBilevelPNGFile

        public static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable,
                       File theFile,
                       double theScale)
                                throws IOException
        Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image with the given scale factor. One display unit = theScale pixels. The default physical pixel dimensions (300×300 pixels per inch) are used.
        Parameters:
        theDisplayable - Displayable object to write.
        theFile - Image file.
        theScale - Scale factor for converting display units to pixels.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • writeBilevelPNGFile

        public static void writeBilevelPNGFile(Displayable theDisplayable,
                       File theFile,
                       double theScale,
                       int xPpi,
                       int yPpi)
                                throws IOException
        Write the given displayable object to a PNG file in the form of a bilevel (black and white) image with the given scale factor and physical pixel dimensions. One display unit = theScale pixels.
        Parameters:
        theDisplayable - Displayable object to write.
        theFile - Image file.
        theScale - Scale factor for converting display units to pixels.
        xPpi - Pixels per inch, X axis.
        yPpi - Pixels per inch, Y axis.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • writeGrayscalePNGFile

                                  throws IOException

        Parameters:
        theDisplayable - Displayable object to write.
        theFile - Image file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

                              throws IOException

        Parameters:

        theFile - Image file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
